pages.text: Deserts are a quite common dry biome (= no rain). It exists in three variants: normal, hills and lakes. Desert Lakes are like normal deserts, but with quite a lot of lakes, $(l:fluids/water)water$() shouldn't be a problem there.

The surface consists of a few layers of $(l:blocks/sand)sand$() on a few layers of sandstone. In the underground, you might find a fossil - a huge formation of $(l:items/bone)bone blocks$() and $(l:basics/ores)coal ore$(), forming parts of dead animals (maybe the Red Dragons?).$(br2)The usual monsters, but not the usual animals spawn. $(l:mobs/zombie)Husks$() replace 80 percent of zombie and zombie villager spawns. You might also cross some $(l:world/tumbleweed)tumbleweeds$() and $(l:mobs/rabbit)rabbits$() here.

Variants of the following structures, with sandstone and jungle wood, can spawn:$(br2)- $(l:structures/village)Villages$()$(br)- $(l:structures/outpost)Outposts$()$(br)- $(l:structures/pyramid)Pyramids$()
